author: Special Correspondent
text:
DMDK’s women’s wing secretary Premalatha on Thursday lashed out at both the AIADMK and the DMK, accusing them of encouraging corruption in administration.

“The DMDK was formed as an alternative to the AIADMK and the DMK. It is true we aligned with the AIADMK in 2011. But the moment our leader realised the government was initiating anti-government policies, he stormed out of the alliance. Our aim is to drive the two parties out of Tamil Nadu,” she said at a meeting here.

Premalatha slams media

Ms. Premalatha also took on the media for publishing what she called “plants” the DMK had floated. “After Mr. Vijayakant asked our propaganda secretary V.C. Chandhrakumar to clarify, the DMK also said there was no (poll) deal,” she claimed.
title: AIADMK, DMK slammed
